result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek R Potratz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Potratz, Derek R

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry
The Court has no objection if the probation agent agrees.
Letter from non-party submitted on behalf of the defendant
Letter from the defendant ref conditions of probation
criminal case settlement
With JI's attached.
Attorney John Dade

Case called at 2:15 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for motion hearing)
Defendant Derek R Potratz in court with Attorney John R Dade. ADA Jeffrey M Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Dade submits notice of appearance and plea paperwork
ADA Shock submits victim impact statement

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #3 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1 & #2
Statement by Jamie Koch; Sentencing Arguments by Counsel

On Counts #3 & #4, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--Complete Anger Management Program as directed by Agent
--No contact with Jamie Koch, including no presence at her residence, unless she consents and the Agent approves
--Comply with family court orders comncerning child custody & placement, Agent may set conditions on child placement
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each count)
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--To pay $200 domestic abuse surcharge ($100 each count)
APPLY CASH BOND TO COSTS

Days credit for time already served: 3 days
Recess: 2:39 pm
In Support of Petition to Alter Bail Bond-Defendant's
Notice of Petition and Petition to Alter Bail Bond-Defendant's
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
Original criminal complaint
Status conference on July 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 
Defendant Derek R Potratz in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Charles B Penwell. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Penwell informs the Court that he is appearing for bond purposes only at this time.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint is correct. Defendant corrects the address to include Apt. 201 and zip code of 53151.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count #1- #4.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $500.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No contact whatsoever with Jamie Koch or the child they have in common

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 1:39 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 7/2/14 at 10:00 am
Status: 7/18/14 at 1:30 pm
